algorithm_technique: Greedy approach using sorting to pair smallest digits
Greedy approach using custom counting sort for optimization
problem_summary_simple: Split a four-digit number's digits into two new numbers to minimize their sum.
problem_summary_technical: Sort digits and greedily form two numbers by alternating smallest digits to minimize their sum.
key_insights: To minimize the sum of two numbers formed from a set of digits, the smaller digits should contribute to the higher place values.
Sorting the digits allows for a greedy assignment to form the two numbers.
Alternating the smallest digits into the two numbers ensures the smallest possible sums.
Custom counting sort can be used for a constant time sort given the fixed range of digits (0-9).
The logic of pairing smallest digits remains the same as the general sorting approach.
This optimization is minor for a fixed 4-digit input but demonstrates understanding of sorting algorithms.
